Name: Creation of a program to distribute catalytic converter etching kits.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of a program to distribute catalytic converter etching kits

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Consumer and Worker Protection

History.Description: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Consumer and Worker Protection

Summary: This bill would require the Police Department, in collaboration with the Department of Transportation and any other appropriate agency, to establish a program to distribute kits to etch identifying numbers into catalytic converters of vehicles for the purpose of deterring theft. These etching kits would be distributed to car dealers. They would also be provided to the public, along with assistance in using the kits. The program would also include an outreach campaign.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      Section 1. Chapter 1 of title 10 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 10-185 to read as follows:
      � 10-185 Catalytic converter etching kit program. a. Definitions. For purposes of this section, the term "etching kit" means a kit used to etch a unique, identifying number into a catalytic converter of a motor vehicle.
      b. The police department, in collaboration with the department of transportation and any other appropriate agency, shall establish a program to:
      1. Distribute etching kits to dealers of new and used motor vehicles for the purpose of etching the catalytic converters of motor vehicles offered for sale;
      2. Provide etching kits to the public and assistance in using such kits to etch catalytic converters; and
      3. Engage in an outreach campaign to inform the public of the efforts required pursuant to paragraphs 1 and 2 of this subdivision.
      � 2. This local law takes effect 90 days after it becomes law.
